title: Revert is slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: Revert operation in the java editor is significantly slower than closing and reopening the editor.
OB: When performing the revert operation in the java editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original code.
EB: The revert operation should be optimized to improve its performance and reduce the time it takes to replace the contents of the window with the original code.
SR:
1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository.
2) Select the end of the first line and add a space character to mark the file as dirty.
3) Close the editor by clicking on the close box in the editor tab.
4) In the 'Do you want to save changes' dialog, choose 'No'.
5) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
6) Repeat steps 1) and 2) to mark the file as dirty again.
7) Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
8) Verify that it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original code.
